thread.title: Missing Hanover 17-year-old found safe states away
thread.title_full: Missing Hanover 17-year-old found safe states away

author: @12OnYourSide
title: Missing Hanover 17-year-old found safe states away
text:
Missing Hanover 17-year-old found safe states away
Published: Dec. 26, 2024 at 5:14 PM EST|Updated: seconds ago
HANOVER, Va. (WWBT) - Henrico Police have confirmed a[ missing 17-year-old last seen in the county was found safe.](https://www.12onyourside.com/2024/12/21/police-missing-henrico-teen-is-endangered/)
Mitchell Harrison Leahey, 17, was last seen around 5:20 p.m. Friday, Dec. 20, in the [4900 block of Dickens Road](https://www.google.com/maps/place/4900+Dickens+Rd,+Richmond,+VA+23230/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89b114360e64623d:0x60cd2b29b0f3657a?sa=X&ved=1t:242&ictx=111).
Virginia State Police issued a [CODI Alert](https://www.12onyourside.com/2024/09/26/state-police-begin-using-codi-alerts-some-missing-children/) on Saturday to help find Leadhey, a Hanover County resident.
On Thursday, police confirmed Mitchell was found safe in Collier County, Florida. Leahey is about to be reunited with his family.
Henrico Police and VSP issued a CODI alert because they believed Mitchell could be in danger. After Leahey was located, the alert was dropped.
